title: 111_s146
content: The "Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2009" allows for injunctions against railroad common carriers and regulates mergers and acquisitions of railroads. SEC. 3 of the "Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2009" amends the Clayton Act to exclude certain transactions authorized by specific government agencies. SEC. 4 limits primary jurisdiction. SEC. 4 amends the Clayton Act to limit primary jurisdiction in civil actions against common carrier railroads. SEC. 5 amends the Clayton Act and FTC Act regarding jurisdiction over common carriers, excluding railroads. SEC. 6 expands treble damages to rail common carriers. SEC. 6 expands treble damages to rail common carriers under the Clayton Act. Section 10706 of title 49, United States Code, is amended to remove references to the Sherman Act and antitrust laws in relation to agreements made by parties. Subsection (e) is also removed and replaced with new language. The amendment to Section 10706 of title 49, United States Code removes references to the Sherman Act and antitrust laws in relation to agreements made by parties. Subsection (e) is replaced with language stating that proposed agreements are not exempt from antitrust laws, and the Board must consider the impact on shippers, consumers, and affected communities. The proposed amendment to Section 11321 of title 49, United States Code clarifies that certain authorities are exempt from all laws except specific antitrust laws. The amendment emphasizes the importance of considering the impact on shippers, consumers, and affected communities. The proposed amendment to Section 11321 of title 49, United States Code clarifies that certain authorities are exempt from all laws except specific antitrust laws, emphasizing the need to consider the impact on shippers, consumers, and affected communities. This includes the application of the Sherman Act, Clayton Act, Federal Trade Commission Act, Wilson Tariff Act, and the Act of June 19, 1936 to transactions described in subsection (a). The Board must consider the impact of transactions on shippers and affected communities for compliance with specific antitrust laws. Amendments are made to section 10706 of title 49, United States Code, regarding rate agreements. Amendments are made to section 10706 of title 49, United States Code, regarding rate agreements. Amendments to section 10706 of title 49, United States Code, regarding rate agreements, will take effect on the date of enactment of this Act. Civil actions or complaints related to conduct exempted from antitrust laws prior to the enactment date must wait 180 days before filing. The Act's enactment date applies to previously exempted conduct or agreements that continue after the enactment date.
